Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: bbrown004
Reviews.Content: Shower had dead bugs on floor.Toliet had to be flushed at least twice. I soap for 3 people. Soap dispenser was empty.Got ready to go to bed found dirty kleenex & rag in between the sheets. Bedding had not been changed.no ice in ice machine. Wanted this special for my sister & my nieces mother. which lives out of town. But didn't work out that way. Don't waste your time..

Reviews.Title: “Looks can be decieving...”
Reviews.Author: Molly N
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I decided against planning for our vacation. We just went with the flow & thought we'd deal with things as they came. It was all supposed to be stress free. When we got to Branson, MO, we saw this hotel on our way through downtown. The outside is neat & looks like an old Victorian house. We liked how the entrance was different. After my boyfriend went inside to see if they had any rooms available, he came out with three nights booked for our stay & an actual KEY. I guess that should have been our first clue since majority of nice hotels have swipe cards for their doors now. Walked in & it actually didn't seem too bad at first for what we paid... but our mind-set completely changed when we both sat down on the bed. It was HARD as a rock. I'm not being sarcastic. I could have laid down on a rock next to Fred Flinestone & been more satisfied. I was very upset about the mattress being so uncomfortable. You'd think they would have some common courtesy about what their guests would be sleeping on. While I was checking out other things in the room, my boyfriend messed around with our air conditioner. He flicked on the air as low as it would go b/c we both like the atmosphere to be freezing when we sleep. We then went walking for a few hours to sight-see. When we came back the room was still stuffy & hot. It was going to be a horrible night. In fact, when we both got in bed we started looking for another hotel to stay in. Neither one of us fell asleep until after midnight. I actually ripped the comforter off the other bed & put it underneath my sheet just for cushion. I had bad back pain most of the next day thanks to that bed. The only nice thing I can say about this hotel is that they didn't question giving us our money back & we were able to book at The Raddison for the next two nights. We were much happier with our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: ladydiana_104
Reviews.Content: They were very nice and attentive to your needs. There is a real key to get into the rooms. Which I really didn't like. Cause If you lost it , it would cost you $60. The beds wasn't comfortable.. I thought it was suppose to be a full breakfast buffet, but it wasn't. Served biscuits/gravy, frozen waffles, donuts and canned fruit, cereals, milk and juices. I would have loved to have a piece of bacon. The inn was not the cleanest. But you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Go elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: WishyaKnew
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of it's fair rates, location on the 76 strip, the offer of a free "deluxe" continental breakfast and nice curb appeal. Unfortunately, there was nothing at all appealing about our room or our stay. We got the regular double queen room (and by looking in empty windows I could tell that the double queen room was the redheaded stepchild of the rooms and treated as such. First, it looked like a motel room out of the70's era. The coffee maker was in the bathroom (gross!) and there was a dead cockroach on the bathroom floor. This was suppose to be a non-smoking room but the stench of cigarette smoke was overwhelming when you first walked in and you could smell it on the covers...which makes you wonder how often they are washed. After getting settled we decided to try the outdoor pool and hot tub. After barely getting in the pool we noticed lots of spiders swimming around and one was rather large with hundreds of baby spiders on her back! I managed to fish her and the babies out with a shoe (and the babies all scattered in different directions) but when I saw the dead scorpion in the pool..I was done. We figured we would just make do with the hot tub. It was cleaner than the pool water anyways. We turned on the jets and got in..only to realize it was not a hot tub, as the water only barely got up to "luke warm" status. There was no option to make the water hotter... only a timer on the jet stream. After a fitful night sleep on the very uncomfortable beds we went to the "delux" continental breakfast at 8am...(which is about when the cleaning people start knocking on your door to come in. A little early, no? And they are dressed like street thugs besides.) The eating room was frigid and the food was gross. Cold, hard biscuits with luke warm white gravy. There was no French Toast as promised. And don't most "deluxe" continental breakfasts offer eggs and some sort of meat? This one had neither. There was coffee, juice, milk, cereal, pre-frozen waffles, biscuits and gravy and canned tropical fruit. There were about 10 people in there and nobody looked very happy. I left hungry and will never visit this establishment again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Susan N
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Branson and stayed another hotel that was not pleasing to us...we checked out the next day and drove along the trip and found the Four Seasons, I stay there was very nice, rooms were cleaned, the indoor and outdoor pool was very nice. Lady at the front desk was so helpful and very kind checking in and checking out. I would recommend this hotel. Our stay was July of 2011 and we plan to stay there again this summer. KCMO mom

Reviews.Title: “Two awful nights at Four Seasons Inn”
Reviews.Author: Normsie
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Four Seasons Inn and it was awful. We were booked for 4 nights, but left after 2. Our room was not cleaned once during the 2 days we were there, we were never given clean towels, and there was nobody in the office during that time, we had to call a special number for assistance. The heater was loud and the room was old and dingy, there was only 1 ice machine working and that was in the main building by the laundry room, and that room was really scary. Their internet was not working and the breakfast was just awful. Biscuits and gravy cold, no fresh fruit or yogurt. Toaster didn't work, but the coffee and orange juice was acceptable. It may be better during peak season, but I would never recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: mandotsan
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights and it was a great place. Pool was closed..but we expected that since its the Fall season. We think thats the best time to visit Branson..not crowded at the hotel..but traffic is still a problem..hate to see what its like at peak season.

Reviews.Title: “We will NEVER go back to this Inn”
Reviews.Author: elizabeth s
Reviews.Content: This was the worst place I have ever stayed in. There were dead and alive crickets in our room and we also found them in our bed! We complained and they put us in the upper level, but there were still a few crickets in that room. They never gave us clean towels or made our beds. When I left I did not go to the front and check out because we just wanted to get the heck out of there. When I did call 4 days later, all they did was say am sorry you did not enjoy your stay. I would never recommend this place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service & Met A Friend”
Reviews.Author: Art-Judy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent a few days in Branson, Mo at the Four Seasons Inn. We are both senior citizens with some age related problems. Our host Linda Kiang went out of her way to accomodate and help us and made our stay that much more pleasant. After knowing her for only a few minutes it was like talking to an old friend rather than a motel employee. Four Seasons should be extremely proud of Linda. In over 40 years of traveling, she is by far the nicest and most down to earth person we have ever dealt with. All employees should be like her.

Reviews.Title: “Our fourth time here and we would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: BlueRose8099
Reviews.Content: I have to say after my fourth time here I haven't found really any reason to complain. This place isn't fancy, but for the reasonable rates I wasn't expecting it to be. Our first time here we stopped in because of the great rates listed on the sign. This place has several buildings, with the back two being surrounded by trees on all three sides (even though it's right on the strip). We don't ever book ahead (since it's the slower season) and we request a room in the back building. It's so quiet back there that we can nap during the day if we want. The rooms have always been clean, and except for the one day we slept in real late, the maids have always come by and cleaned our room while we were out for the day. We've only been to the breakfast room a few times, as we're usually not up for the early breakfast hours. It's not a big breakfast spread, but I wouldn't expect much with the reasonable hotel rates. Any time we've had any problems for maintenance they've been addressed right away. All in all we love this place and would stay here again in the future provided the rates stay as reasonable as they have always been.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: OlderThanDirt27
Reviews.Content: They don't pretend to be something they are not! Clean rooms. Older property. Big continental breakfast (biscuits & gravy). Motel style (outdoor doors). EXCELLENT customer service and personnel. About 1/2 the price of other properties in Branson. You even get NATURE on 3 sides and yet right on the Strip. Cleanest pool I've ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Sold our room”
Reviews.Author: mjv30068
Reviews.Content: We reserved a room and had a guaranteed confirmed reservation. When we arrived at 10 PM the Four Seasons Inn had sold our room. They could not provide a room. We waited in the lobby for 1 hour while the desk clerk called throughout Branson and surrounding towns for a spare room. She only found a smoking room at an inferior quality hotel. We drove 45 miles and found a room on our own. So, a confirmed reservation is meaningless. They did refund our deposit but we did not find a room until midnight.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure the beds were even changed, considering condition of room!!”
Reviews.Author: zezula
Reviews.Content: Stayed just two nights, came to town for business. Arrived from KC around 9p.m. - evidently almost the only tenant. (should have been a hint!) Entered room, there was a cigerett package on the floor, picked it up to throw away, reluctantly upacked, as I went to the lavatory area, looked down at he coffee service area, it had never been cleaned, coffee, sugar, etc all over it! Looked in the coffee basket, filter and coffee from last tenant still there!!!! So I looked at the bath area - tub had "kinda been cleaned" - still left with soap film and hair, but you could see streaks from an attempt at wiping the wall-!! Called the front desk - "Oh, I'm sorry, I will make a note of it." was what I got - I cleaned the room before I went to bed. The next day I got out really early, didn't want any of the "staff" in the room so, put do not disturb sign on door. When I got ready to check out I expected someone to at least acknowledge the complaint, but the older lady at the FD said nothing, so I had to ask if anything had been said about the complaint - yes, but no discount, nothing, I feel it was a rip-off!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: ZXpres
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and very comfortable and the room rate was very affordable. The breakfast was more than we expected and tasted good. We will tell our family and friends about The Four Seasons Inn in Branson and we will stay there again. The staff members were very polite and helpful also.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a SMILE!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I brought a group of 18 senior adults to the Four Seasons to stay Monday-Wednesday. We were greeted warmly and our rooms were clean and adequate. So the towels weren't huge and fluffy, they were clean and replaced each day. What really stood out was the staff! Our bus broke down while we were there and every single staff person pitched in to lend a hand, using their own cars to shuttle us back and forth and encouraging us and praying for us. They loaned us their van to use for our group so we would not miss our shows. All with huge smiles, hugs and encouraging words. If you are looking for a great location, great price, and wonderful friendly, Christian service, you will not be sorry you stayed here. We had no problems with the rooms and the breakfast was exactly what they told us it would be.

HotelInfo.Name: Four Seasons Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 1360 West Highway 76 W, Branson, MO 65616 (Formerly Country Hearth Inn)
